item.title: IFComp 2018
item.description: I’ve set a new goal for StupidRPG. I’ll be entering it into the 2018 Interactive Fiction Competition. 9/28/2018.
item.content:encoded: I’ve set a new goal for StupidRPG. I’ll be entering it into the 2018 Interactive Fiction Competition. 9/28/2018.

item.title: Daily Update 2016.06.08
item.description:
More DD&D playtesting.

Did a flow diagram of the first two segments of the “not dungeon crawl”, which I’m reasonably happy wit
item.content:encoded:
More DD&D playtesting.

Did a flow diagram of the first two segments of the “not dungeon crawl”, which I’m reasonably happy with. Not sure I can fit it into a single session, so I need to plan a good breather point somewhere in the middle.

Some general objectives:

  • Don’t utter the words “dungeon crawl” at any point.
  • Give every character important things to accomplish, whether that’s holding off a wave of thralls, bypassing a locked blast door, or restarting a steam turbine.
  • Risk of death.
  • Forward the plot(s) with relevant NPCs and the Plague.
  • Every room should feel like it has a purpose.

item.title: Daily Update 2016.06.07
item.description: Did some playtesting of DumDums & Dragons today. It’s a friend’s goofy lite RPG system, lots of fun. Only a little time has passed si
item.content:encoded: Did some playtesting of DumDums & Dragons today. It’s a friend’s goofy lite RPG system, lots of fun. Only a little time has passed since the first time I looked at it, but the character creator I built is already in need of updates.

item.title: Daily Update 2016.06.06
item.description: Finally found a use for my old smartphone. Turns out there are a couple apps that will let you use a smartphone as a makeshift security c
item.content:encoded: Finally found a use for my old smartphone. Turns out there are a couple apps that will let you use a smartphone as a makeshift security camera. Nice alternative to letting it sit in a closet like some kind of zombie device.

item.title: Daily Update 2016.06.05
item.description: Ran D&D for the first time in 7 months. It went well, everyone got back into the groove without too much trouble. I ran the players t
item.content:encoded:
Ran D&D for the first time in 7 months. It went well, everyone got back into the groove without too much trouble. I ran the players through a masquerade ball with a planning segment, a fair bit of intrigue, and multiple objectives. No combat, only one death, so a pretty good party.

They also met some key characters for the plotline going forward.

Next up, I have some bigger plans for the rebellion. I’m also working through what makes a good/bad dungeon crawl. I’d like to trick them into enjoying a dungeon crawl by making it plot relevant in a big way.

item.title: Daily Update 2016.06.04
item.description: I think I have the reverse-power to choose who wins DOTA2 tournaments. Every team I root for loses.
item.content:encoded: I think I have the reverse-power to choose who wins DOTA2 tournaments. Every team I root for loses.

Invitation mockup for the D&D masquerade. I like to occasionally hand out physical items to the players; it helps set the mood.

<
item.content:encoded: Invitation mockup for the D&D masquerade. I like to occasionally hand out physical items to the players; it helps set the mood.

item.title: Daily Update 2016.06.01
item.description: In retrospect, I should have been tagging these posts better (or at all, in many cases). Second time I’ve written a bunch of game content
item.content:encoded:
In retrospect, I should have been tagging these posts better (or at all, in many cases). Second time I’ve written a bunch of game content, only to find I had separately written the same content in the dev journal much earlier.

Usually the stuff in the journal is better. Writing prose in a code editor doesn’t stir the creative juices, apparently.

item.title: Daily Update 2016.05.31
item.description: Decided when I reach 365 posts (a year, give or take), I’m going to switch to a more ad-hoc schedule. The daily dev journal started as a
item.content:encoded:
Decided when I reach 365 posts (a year, give or take), I’m going to switch to a more ad-hoc schedule. The daily dev journal started as a way to motivate me to work on SRPG every day, but over time it’s morphed to the point where I spend more time worrying about updating the journal than I do actually making the game.

No regrets, though.

item.title: Aggregation #32
item.description:
Changes & Updates:

  • Added full descriptions for circle and armory.
  • Added full descriptions for
item.content:encoded:
Changes & Updates:

  • Added full descriptions for circle and armory.
  • Added full descriptions for bedchamber and bottom of goblin pit.
  • Alluded to the pail of infinite sadness.
  • Alluded to the Shadowbeast.
  • Added full description for chalice room.
  • Added full descriptions for Goblin Pit, Wine Cellar, Good Wine Cellar.
  • Added full description for Great Hall.
  • Ran the first part of the aethernaut quest, including the canyon, viewing room and Observer.
  • Added full descriptions for Winding Stairs, Treasury, Ogre Cage, and Spider Room.
  • Repo cleanup (hadn’t committed in a long time)
  • Got a logo from a generous friend.
  • Build a first draft of a landing page w/logo for the pre-launch display.
